titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Ray Bradbury Papers LSC.0471
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Yvonne Schroeder, July 1960; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-04 16:43:24 -0700.

did.abstract: Ray Douglas Bradbury (1920- ) has authored numerous novels, short stories, plays, films, poems, and articles, including he Martian Chronicles (1950), Dandelion Wine, and Something Wicked this Way Comes. The collection consists of manuscripts, correspondence, and ephemera by and related to Ray Bradbury.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ray Bradbury Papers (Collection 471). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Ray Douglas Bradbury was born in Waukegan, Illinois, August 22, 1920; started his writing career in 1943; the winner of various awards, he is known primarily for writing fantasy and science fiction stories; he has authored numerous novels, short stories, plays, films, poems, and articles, including The Martian Chronicles (1950), Dandelion Wine, and Something Wicked this Way Comes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of manuscripts, correspondence, and ephemera by and related to Ray Bradbury. Includes various titles including The Martian Chronicles. Also includes a copy of Moby Dick screenplay and a radio script for the The Whole Town's Sleeping.

altformavail.head: Additional Physical Form Available
altformavail.p: A copy of the original version of this online finding aid is available at the UCLA Library Special Collections for in-house consultation and may be obtained for a fee. Please contact:

list.item: UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections
Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The Dogs That Eat Sweet Grass [oral history transcript] / Ray Bradbury, interviewee. UCLA Oral History Department interview, 1961. Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.

did.unittitle: he Martian Chronicles. Published by Doubleday & Company, Garden City, New York,
did.physdesc: Typescript with holograph corrections and printer's notations. 293 leaves.
Corrected galley proofs. 66 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also: 15 leaves of page proofs with printer's notations (not text).

did.physdesc: [Screenplay] Mimeographed. In green paper binder. 148pp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Final - but not final shooting script - this is mimeographed copy of script as started October 7, 1953 and finished April 16, 1954 - by R. Bradbury - Huston, later, in shooting film - made some deletions & changes./ R.B.

did.unittitle: The Murderer. In he Golden Apples of the Sun published by Rupert Hart-Davis, London, Manuscript dated
did.physdesc: Typescript with extensive holograph corrections. 17 leaves. In yellow paper binder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First draft.

did.physdesc: 31 leaves total. Both typescripts together in green paper binder. Typescript with holograph corrections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First draft of first, original, unused version - plus first draft of second, entirely different version - R.B.. Published in Golden Apples of the Sun.

did.physdesc: Typescript with corrections. 13 leaves. In orange paper binder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First draft. Published in Golden Apples of the Sun.

did.physdesc: Typescript (partly carbon). Extensive corrections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First 3 drafts of story/ Progressively cut and edited. Published in Farenheit 451 - 1953 by Ballantine Books, Incorporated, New York.

did.physdesc: Typescript (some carbon) and mimeographed. 25 leaves. In yellow paper binder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First draft... published in McCalls as The Whole Town's Sleeping/ will appear as part of Doubleday book Dandelion Wine, May 1957.

did.physdesc: Typescript (carbon) with corrections. Second draft. 9 leaves. In yellow paper binder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Published in A Medicine for Melancholy, Doubleday, Garden City, New York, 1959.

did.physdesc: Typescript (carbon). 9 leaves. In green paper binder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Original version, 1952. Published in A Medicine for Melancholy, 1959, and in Collier's 1954 under the title The Marriage Mender.

did.physdesc: Typescript with corrections. First leaf has numerous holograph comments and markings on both sides. 12 leaves. In blue paper binder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First draft. To appear 1957 in Dandelion Wine.

did.unittitle: The Sound of Thunder. Los Angeles,
did.physdesc: Typescript (carbon) with extensive corrections. 20 leaves. In yellow paper binder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Published in Collier's, 1952.

did.physdesc: Typescript (partly carbon) with extensive holograph corrections. 25 leaves. In orange paper binder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2nd draft. First leaf has explanatory note.

did.unittitle: he Fox in the Forest. Venice, California,
did.physdesc: Typescript (some carbon) with occasional corrections. 37 leaves. In green paper binder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Final draft.

did.unittitle: he Wonderful Death of Dudley Stone.
did.physdesc: 24 leaves. In orange paper binder. Typescript with extensive corrections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Second leaf has many holograph notations and markings and is entitled The Incredible Death of Dudley Stone. Dated June 1952-June 1953.

did.unittitle: he Great Collision of Monday Last.
did.physdesc: Typescript (carbon). 12 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Next to final draft - R.B.

did.unittitle: he First Night of Lent; a one-act play.
did.physdesc: Typescript with extensive corrections. 31 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First draft.

did.physdesc: Typescript with some corrections. 12 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First draft. Based on a fragment of conversation with Ben Maddow, returned from Ireland, at lunch, December 15, 1958.

did.physdesc: Typescripts. 7 items. In folder.

did.unittitle: Ephemera. Newspapers and magazines with material about and by Ray Bradbury.
did.physdesc: 7 items.

did.unittitle: Other Worlds; Science Stories. vol.1 no.3 ().

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains Punishment Without Crime by Ray Bradbury. pp.6-13.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains The Fireman by Ray Bradbury. pp.4-61.

did.unittitle: Ellery Queen's Mystery Magazine. vol.32 no.4 .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains The Town Where no one Got Off by Ray Bradbury. pp.108-114.

did.unittitle: he Science Fiction Galaxy. Permabooks, New York,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains reprint of King of the Grey Spaces by Ray Bradbury. pp.208-226.

did.physdesc: 17 items.

did.unittitle: Bradbury, Ray, A Medicine for Melancholy. Los Angeles,
did.physdesc: Typescript with holograph corrections. 289 leaves.

list.item: First published by Doubleday & Company, Garden City, New York, 1959.
This is a collection of short stories, previously published in periodicals.
Final typescript from which type was set.

did.physdesc: 65 sheets. Galley proofs with corrections in ink.
81 sheets. Page proofs with a few corrections in red pencil.

did.unittitle: --- Interview made by the Oral History Program, UCLA. Los Angeles,
did.physdesc: Typescript (carbon) 462 leaves. 28cm.

list.item: This is the unedited transcript of the tapes, now erased.
Interview conducted by Craig Cunningham, January 12-April 11, 1961.

did.physdesc: Mimeographed with corrections in red and black pencil. 20 leaves. 28cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A radio script broadcast on Suspence, August 31, 1958. This is apparently the copy used by the producer-director, William Robson.
